p: B. vulgaris contains benzodioxoloquinolizine alkaloid (berberine), which is shown to significantly induce interleukin (IL)-12 production in a dose-dependent manner to counter the effects of HCV infection. IL-12 consequently increased the IFN-Î³ production and decreased the IL-4 level in antigen primed CD4 + T cells. Berberine also stimulates the T helper lymphocytes subset 1 (Th1) cytokine synthesis and decreases the Th2 subset ( 10, 115). The fruit of the plant have medicinal importance due to its antioxidant, anticancer, anti-inflammatory, antidiabetic, antibacterial, and hepatoprotective properties ( 116).
